data: Antiquarium e museo civico di Aci Castello
A very small collection with superb Stentinello pottery, amphorae and anchors (plus fossils and a mineralogical collection)
Funerary inscription for the son of Artemon
Remains of two lines, damaged at either end, seemingly centered

Regular square letters of even height. Alpha has broken bar; epsilon has shorter middle bar; mu has vertical first and last, with the middle strokes meeting mid-way above the baseline; omicron is full size; rho has small eye;  omega is broad and lunate.
More likely late hellenistic than early imperial (lunate omega not before the second century BCE and rare on stone so early)
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Manganaro, 1999, Sikelika: studi di antichità e di epigrafia della Sicilia greca
